alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 6:25AM EDT until May 03 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Hunterdon and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated ongoing flooding due to the heavy rainfall that moved through last night. The gauge along the Millstone River at Griggstown has exceeded moderate flood stage of 12.0 feet as it`s currently at 13.1 feet. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Somerville, Somerset, Bridgewater, Manville, Flemington, Millstone, Flagtown, Belle Mead, Skillman, Cloverhill, and Raritan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
